oai_dc:dc.dc:title: An Evaluation of Feedlot Arrival Castration Status on Individual Animal Performance Over a 61-Day Preconditioning Period in Calves Having an Ultra-High Risk of Developing Bovine Respiratory Disease
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: May, M. L.
Krehbiel, C. R.
Schunicht, O. C.
Peterson, R. E.
Booker, C. W.
Burciaga-Robles, L. O.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: castration
feedlot performance
feed intake
animal health
male calves
preconditioning
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Castration at feedlot arrival may contribute to animal stress, and therefore have potential effects on feedlot performance and health. The purpose of this study was to follow two populations of male calves (those castrated prior to feedlot arrival and those castrated at the time of feedlot arrival) over a 61 day preconditioning period and to compare performance data based on individual animal feed intakes (GrowSafe Systems Ltd., Airdrie, Canada).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2011; 169
